Others: Lonzo Ball made his long-awaited return to the NBA, scoring 10 points in 15 minutes in the Chicago Bulls' preseason victory over the Minnesota Timberwolves.
Ball underwent a cartilage and meniscus transplant in his left knee last year after several procedures failed to fix his injury.
Ball's tenure in Chicago got off to a good start following a sign-and-trade deal with New Orleans prior to the 2021-22 season.
The Bulls have a crowd in the backcourt, with Coby White coming off a breakthrough season and Josh Giddey in the mix following a trade from Oklahoma City.
Ball's return to the court marks the end of a long journey and a significant milestone in his career.
